results.title: Ten-year experience in atenolol use and exercise evaluation in children with genetically proven long QT syndrome
results.text_hl: This study aimed to review the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ for children and adolescents with genetically proven @<m>DISEASE_Romano_Ward_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029597 @@@LQTS type 1@@@ (@GENE_KCNQ1 @GENE_3784 @@@LQT1@@@) @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@and type 2@@@ (@DISEASE_Long_Qt_Syndrome_2 @DISEASE_MESH:C563614 @@@LQT2@@@).

citations.NLM: Kwok SY, Pflaumer A, Pantaleo SJ, Date E, Jadhav M, Davis AM. Ten-year experience in atenolol use and exercise evaluation in children with genetically proven long QT syndrome J Arrhythm. 2017 Dec;33(6):624-629. PMID: 29255512
citations.BibTeX: @article{29255512, title={Ten-year experience in atenolol use and exercise evaluation in children with genetically proven long QT syndrome}, author={Kwok SY and Pflaumer A and Pantaleo SJ and Date E and Jadhav M and Davis AM}, journal={J Arrhythm}, volume={33}, number={6}, pages={624-629}}

results.title: Experience with bisoprolol in long-QT1 and long-QT2 syndrome.
results.text_hl: METHODS: We performed a retrospective cohort study of 114 consecutive @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with gene-positive @<m>DISEASE_Romano_Ward_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029597 @@@Long-QT syndrome type 1@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Romano_Ward_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029597 @@@LQT1@@@) or @DISEASE_Long_Qt_Syndrome_2 @DISEASE_MESH:C563614 @@@Long-QT syndrome type 2@@@ (@DISEASE_Long_Qt_Syndrome_2 @DISEASE_MESH:C563614 @@@LQT2@@@) treated with @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Nadolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009248 @@@nadolol@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ with a total of 580 person-years of follow-up.

citations.NLM: Steinberg C, Padfield GJ, Al-Sabeq B, Adler A, Yeung-Lai-Wah JA, Kerr CR, Deyell MW, Andrade JG, Bennett MT, Yee R, Klein GJ, Green M, Laksman ZW, Krahn AD, Chakrabarti S. Experience with bisoprolol in long-QT1 and long-QT2 syndrome. J Interv Card Electrophysiol. 2016 Nov;47(2):163-170. PMID: 27394160
citations.BibTeX: @article{27394160, title={Experience with bisoprolol in long-QT1 and long-QT2 syndrome.}, author={Steinberg C and Padfield GJ and Al-Sabeq B and Adler A and Yeung-Lai-Wah JA and Kerr CR and Deyell MW and Andrade JG and Bennett MT and Yee R and Klein GJ and Green M and Laksman ZW and Krahn AD and Chakrabarti S}, journal={J Interv Card Electrophysiol}, volume={47}, number={2}, pages={163-170}}

results.title: Beta-blocker therapy failures in symptomatic probands with genotyped long-QT syndrome.
results.text_hl: Of the 13 breakthroughs occurring while compliant, 10 occurred with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and 3 with @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ (p = 0.03).

citations.NLM: Chatrath R, Bell CM, Ackerman MJ. Beta-blocker therapy failures in symptomatic probands with genotyped long-QT syndrome. Pediatr Cardiol. 2004 Sep-Oct;25(5):459-65. PMID: 15534720
citations.BibTeX: @article{15534720, title={Beta-blocker therapy failures in symptomatic probands with genotyped long-QT syndrome.}, author={Chatrath R and Bell CM and Ackerman MJ}, journal={Pediatr Cardiol}, volume={25}, number={5}, pages={459-65}}

results.title: Comparison of HERG channel blocking effects of various beta-blockers-- implication for clinical strategy.
results.text_hl: Our results provide additional strategies for clinical usage of beta-blockers. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@ may be preferable for @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Romano_Ward_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029597 @@@type 1 and 2 long QT syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Kawakami K, Nagatomo T, Abe H, Kikuchi K, Takemasa H, Anson BD, Delisle BP, January CT, Nakashima Y. Comparison of HERG channel blocking effects of various beta-blockers-- implication for clinical strategy. Br J Pharmacol. 2006 Mar;147(6):642-52. PMID: 16314852
citations.BibTeX: @article{16314852, title={Comparison of HERG channel blocking effects of various beta-blockers-- implication for clinical strategy.}, author={Kawakami K and Nagatomo T and Abe H and Kikuchi K and Takemasa H and Anson BD and Delisle BP and January CT and Nakashima Y}, journal={Br J Pharmacol}, volume={147}, number={6}, pages={642-52}}

results.title: Effectiveness of beta-blockers depending on the genotype of congenital long-QT syndrome: A meta-analysis

citations.NLM: Ahn J, Kim HJ, Choi JI, Lee KN, Shim J, Ahn HS, Kim YH. Effectiveness of beta-blockers depending on the genotype of congenital long-QT syndrome: A meta-analysis PLoS One. 2017;12(10):e0185680. PMID: 29059199
